data.author: Matthias Schoepfer
data.message:
Replacing BSD with BSD-3-Clause in package.xml

Updating the package.xml license tags to hold valid SPDX qualifiers.
The rationale behind this is, that with
[meta-ros](https://github.com/ros/meta-ros) and
[superflore](https://github.com/ros-infrastructure/superflore)
recipes get generated for the OpenEmbedded Linux build system.
It will fetch the license tag and copy it over into the recipe. If
no valid SPDX identifiers get found, it will issue an error, and a
manual step to fix this is needed.

See the SPDX identifiers
[BSD-3-Clause](https://spdx.org/licenses/BSD-3-Clause.html)

Signed-off-by: Matthias Schoepfer <m.schoepfer@rethinkrobotics.com>

data.author: Daniel Stonier
data.message:
[infra] fix a bunch of problems pointed out by clang static analysis. (#100)

There are a few changes in here:

1.  A bugfix, where a check for NULL was missed.
2.  Another bugfix, where a NULL pointer was assigned to in
an error path.
3.  A bunch of dead assignments in tests.  These aren't really
bugs per se, but it is a good warning to have on so we remove these
dead assignments.
4.  Switch the statistics counter from a float to an unsigned int64.
5.  Initialize variables in a few places to make sure we don't
access uninitialized memory.
6.  Some dead code removal.

Also cleanup flops.cpp (but no functional change)

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

Co-authored-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@gmail.com>

data.author: Daniel Stonier
data.message:
[infra] no system includes (#95)

Actually would like to see warnings from underlying ecl packages
and regardless, have run into trouble in the past with system
includes due to the ordering influences. Recommendation
from Dirk Thomas was not to use system in a ros environment.

data.author: Daniel Stonier
data.message:
[infra] revert workaround for exporting interfaces with libraries (#81)

* [infra] rever the workaround (PR #73) for interface library exports

Hitherto would cause a problem on builds with isolated installs, so
you are supposed to explicitly state the target name, refer to

- https://github.com/ament/ament_cmake/issues/132
- https://github.com/ament/ament_cmake/pull/135/files

Colcon/bouncy doesn't reproduce our earlier problems since it exports all of the appropriate paths regardless. This however, should be the right fix.

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Fix warnings (#80)

* Workaround unused argument warning.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Workaround unused variables warning from gcc.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Workaround unused argc and argv in ecl_converters.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Workaround unused variables in ecl_utilities.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Remove dynamic exception specification.

They are now deprecated in C++.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Fix signed/unsigned warning in the tests.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Rearrange class member variables.

That way they match the order that they are initialized in
the constructor, removing a reorder warning.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Make sure to "use" t to avoid a set-but-not-used warning in ecl_time.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Remove an unused calculation from ecl_linear_algebra

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Workaround unused variables in ecl_sigslots.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Remove an unused iterator from ecl_sigslots.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Make read_timeout_ms a signed long.

That's because "NonBlocking" is specified as -1.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Remove unused ret value in ecl_devices.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Workaround warnings for unused variables in ecl_geometry.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Used unsigned variables for loop iterators with vectors in ecl_geometry.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Workaround unused variables in ecl_streams.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Compare against unsigned for stream device remaining.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Workaround unused variable warnings.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Remove dynamic exception specifications in ecl_core_apps.

They are deprecated in C++.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Remove unused variables in ecl_core_apps.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Workaround unused variables in ecl_mobile_robot.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* Make sure to compare container size against unsigned in ecl_geometry.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

* [all] more concise commented argc, argv

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Make sure to ament_export_libraries. (#73)

ament_export_libraries() ends up generating a setup.sh file
for each library that exports LD_LIBRARY_PATH.  This is
important when building in isolated mode so that downstream
consumers of the libraries can find the library at runtime.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Dmitry Rozhkov
data.message:
[ecl_containers] Fix gcc v7.1 compilation issue (#58)

When built with gcc v7.1 compilation fails with an error message
about using an expression as a function when updating
the private attribute FloatContainerFormatter.prm_width.

The patch uses assignment to update the attribute.

Signed-off-by: Dmitry Rozhkov <dmitry.rozhkov@linux.intel.com>
